checks.detail: proxy_ok=True (lab Δν≈2.084e-23 Hz, astro Δν≈2.382e-07 Hz; thresholds=1.0e-09 Hz)

rows.label: Lab spin fluid (He-3 benchmark)
rows.note: Order-of-magnitude lab density; intended as a falsifiability baseline.

rows.label: Nuclear spin density (magnetar proxy)
rows.note: Order-of-magnitude nuclear density; not an Earth lab bound regime. Intended for astrophysical amplification discussion.

gaps: Benchmarks use a toy source model and TFPT-scale coupling assumption; publication-grade needs derived source dynamics + real observables/noise model.
inputs: TFPT scale M from constants (R^2 scale) used as coupling-scale proxy
torsion bounds mapping constant k=3/4 (minimal coupling)
spec.name: Torsion observable designer (magnetar + lab signal proxies)
objective: Turn the torsion-falsifiability task into a concrete, assumption-explicit signal-size table.
Provide a path to a real experimental design (replace benchmarks with a derived source model + instrument noise model).
outputs: two benchmark scenarios (lab spin-fluid, nuclear/magnetar-like spin density) with predicted Δν scales
amplitude_measurable gate (design-phase; physics mode remains strict)
spec.question: What torsion observable magnitude could be targeted in lab vs astrophysical regimes under TFPT-scale coupling assumptions?
validation: amplitude_measurable check is emitted (PASS/WARN/FAIL depending on mode and proxy thresholds).
